snippet: For tests given last spring under the new Common Core requirements, the description of the results comes down to the different labels each state uses to describe the exact same scores on the same tests.
abstract: States' differing criteria for student proficiency in grading standardized test scores has added to inconsistency of academic standards Common Core requirements were intended to redress;  objections to Common Core standards from educators and parents may underlie adjustments of goal posts and broadening of definition of success taking place in some states.

keywords.value: Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (Parcc)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: For tests given last spring under the new Common Core requirements, the description of the results comes down to the different labels each state uses to describe the exact same scores on the same tests.

headline.print_headline: Test Scores Under Common Core Show ‘Proficient’ Varies by State
headline.main: Test Scores Under Common Core Show That ‘Proficient’ Varies by State
